newsitem.title: AZERBAIJAN: SOCCER-FINLAND GAIN FIRST WORLD CUP POINTS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-FINLAND GAIN FIRST WORLD CUP POINTS.

text.p: Finland gained their first World Cup points with a 2-1 win over Azerbaijan in a European group three qualifier on Wednesday.
Ajax Amsterdam's Jari Litmanen opened the scoring in the 25th minute, seizing on a wayward pass from Azeri defender Mehman Yunusov inside the penalty area.

Bolton striker Mika-Matti Paatelainen made it 2-0 for the visitors in the 66th minute when his shot beat Azeri keeper Aleksandr Jidkov before Nazim Suleymanov secured a consolation for the hosts from the penalty spot with 10 minutes remaining.

The win allowed Finland to escape the bottom of their group and put them in third place on goal difference ahead of Switzerland and Azerbaijan. All three teams have just one win to their credit but the Azeris have played one game more.
Norway lead the group with maximum points from three games and Hungary lie second on six points.
